page.title: 03SCHOOL OF MILITARY SURVEY
page.content: Two men from the School of Militaru Survey came to visit us in school and showed us some of their map making equipment and slides. We were very interested, especially as some of our dads work there. They told us that the building was an American military hospital in World War 2 and the School moved to Hermitage in 1949. Their job is to make maps for the RAF, the Army and the Navy, and also people come from all over the world to learn about map making. First the field surveyors go out and use trig points to mark where they are, and they use planes equipped with cameras to show what the whole world looks like. The cartographers draw neat maps, or automated cartographers are used, and the information is plotted onto a computer disc. Finally lots of maps are printed off.
